description.narrative: International Alert is an independent peacebuilding non-governmental organisation. It has a global mission to work with people in conflict-affected and -threatened areas to make a positive difference for peace; to improve the substance and implementation of international policies relevant to peacebuilding; and to strengthen the peacebuilding sector, with a key focus on gender, climate change and natural resuorce management linked to conflict, and economic development for peace. Its main methods of engagement include bringing people together through dialogue; capacity building through trainings, accompaniment (which involves guidance to people, organisations and companies that operate in high-risk environments) and undertaking policy research and advocacy. With Headquarters in London, Alert is active and collaborates with around 160 organisations in 21 countries and territories.

International Alert är en oberoende och icke-statlig organisation med globalt fredsbyggande uppdrag att arbeta med människor i konfliktdrabbade områden. Syftet med International Alerts arbete är att stärka förutsättningar för fredlig utveckling, stärka implementeringen av internationella policies som är relevanta för fredsbyggande, och att stärka fredsbyggande sektorn, med ett tydligt fokus på jämställdhet, klimatförändringar och naturresurshantering kopplat till konflikt och ekonomisk utveckling för fred. Organisationens huvudsakliga arbetssätt är att föra människor samman via dialog, kapacitetsutveckling via utbildningar, medföljande (vilket omfattar vägledning och råd till människor, organisationer och företag som verkar i högriskområden) och att genomföra policyforskning och påverkansarbete. Med huvudkontor i London bedriver organisationen verksamhet i 21 länder och regioner världen över, i samarbete med runt 160 organisationer.

The overall objectives of the Core Activities shall support International Alert to deliver against its objectives as set out in their Strategic Plan (012939/19). The mission statements, as shown under Introduction and Agreement structure above, will inform informs the Strategic Plan 2019 - 2023 and the forthcoming strategy (2024 2028). The proposed support will continue to contribute to the five goals of Alert's strategic plan, namely:
1. Strengthen communities voices and their capacity to reduce violence, in particular by working with disadvantaged women and young people. 2. Harness the private sector to support inclusive peace. 3. Promote fairness, inclusion and justice in local and national governance systems, including security, to support peace and address the root causes of conflict, including structural inequalities 4. Support inclusive peace processes and wider peacebuilding initiatives 5. Champion gender- and conflict-sensitivity in ways that contribute to peace, including in International Alerts own work.
The proposed grant includes an earmarked component to strengthen Alerts programming, knowledge base and policy work on climate, environment and conflict during 2022-2023. This workstream spans across all five objectives of the Strategic Plan. The overarching goal of the proposed intervention is for Alert to contribute to reducing climate change and natural resource management-related conflicts by strengthening technical expertise and influencing capacity. This work specifically speaks to Sidas increased focus on Environment, Climate, Peace and Security.

sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution

tag.narrative: 10.2 - By 2030, empower and promote the social, economic and political inclusion of all, irrespective of age, sex, disability, race, ethnicity, origin, religion or economic or other status.

10.2 - Till 2030 möjliggöra och verka för att alla människors, oavsett ålder, kön, funktionsnedsättning, ras, etnicitet, ursprung, religion eller ekonomisk eller annan ställning, blir inkluderade i det sociala, ekonomiska och politiska livet.
16.1 - Avsevärt minska alla former av våld och dödligt våld överallt.
16.1 - Significantly reduce all forms of violence and related death rates everywhere.
5.5 - Ensure women’s full and effective participation and equal opportunities for leadership at all levels of decision-making in political, economic and public life.
5.5 - Tillförsäkra kvinnor fullt och faktiskt deltagande och lika möjligheter till ledarskap på alla beslutsnivåer i det politiska, ekonomiska och offentliga livet.
